critique: The document is an executive order detailing the temporary assignment of an Army officer to two government corporations. The tone is formal and authoritative. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is likely a sense of confidence and assurance that the government is functioning effectively. There is no explicit mention of emotions, so the scores are based on the implied emotions through the actions and policies enacted. Initial scores: Joy: 2, Sadness: 1, Anger: 1, Fear: 1, Disgust: 1, Surprise: 1. Revised scores: Joy: 2, Sadness: 1, Anger: 1, Fear: 1, Disgust: 1, Surprise: 1
